newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Dutch money rates, guilder-mark steady.
newsitem.headline: Dutch money rates, guilder-mark steady.

text.p: Overnight guilders tended fractionally higher on Wednesday on the back of the latest special advances allocation, but other Dutch money rates were largely unchanged in routine trade, dealers said.
They said overnight guilders were dealing at between 2.69 and 2.81 percent compared with Tuesday's bid rate of 2.68 pct.
The Dutch central bank earlier announced it had allocated 1.66 billion guilders to the money market under a five-day special advances pact at an unchanged rate of 2.5 percent.
"The allocation looks quite tight, but the market seems to have no problems with it," one dealer said.
He said there were likely other flows of money into the market, including the buy-back of Dutch treasury certificates by the finance ministry's Agent.
The guilder was solid against the mark, quoting at 112.095 per 100 marks, unchanged from Tuesday's fixing.
